info.description:
The IO Engineering API is used to generate and edit **ctrlX CORE IO configurations** that are used in automatic commissioning.
Refer [Online Documentation](https://developer.community.boschrexroth.com/t5/Store-and-How-to/Generate-API-client-libraries-from-Engineering-API/ba-p/52314) for API client library generation.
info.title: ctrlX IO Engineering API

tags.description: This is the Devices view. Here you organize elements for the special devices of the current project.
tags.name: Devices

tags.description: Here you can read and edit the Device repository.
tags.name: Device Repositories

tags.description: Jobs are used to execute and check long running operations such as project open, close.
tags.name: Jobs

tags.description: This is the POUs view. Here you organize general elements of the current project.
tags.name: POUs

tags.description: To get detailed version information of the installed product.
tags.name: Product

tags.description: Here you have general commands for projects.
tags.name: Project

tags.description: Here you can configure the user management for the current project.
tags.name: Users and Groups

post.summary: to create a new element and append it to the root element of the Devices view

parameters.description:
This is the path to the element.
- The char "." is not allowed in the name, because it is used in case of ambiguity.
- If there is an ambiguity between different element names, you can address the element by the option "name.type"

  Example: A Folder "TestName" with the path: `PickingUnit/TestName.Folder` and a POU "TestName" with the path: `PickingUnit/TestName.POU`
parameters.name: path

EtherCAT Master
	  
EtherCAT is a registered trademark and patented technology, licensed by Beckhoff Automation GmbH, Germany.

path.description:
This is the path to the element.
- The char "." is not allowed in the name, because it is used in case of ambiguity.
- If there is an ambiguity between different element names, you can address the element by the option "name.type"

  Example: A Folder "TestName" with the path: `PickingUnit/TestName.Folder` and a POU "TestName" with the path: `PickingUnit/TestName.POU`
path.name: path

name.description: This is the name of a recipeVariable or a recipe.
name.name: name

BaseElement.description: BaseElement is an abstraction level with the basic properties. The property "elementType" is mandatory. It is equal to the name of the schema

id.description: Globally Unique Identifier (GUID) of an element. Top level 'Devices' & 'POUs' return null.

children.description:
The array children contains each name of the child-elements.

If there are elements with identical names, the elementType will be added to the name. 
For Example:            
- "test.Folder"

CommunicationSettingsJob.description: The job connects IO Engineering to the device.

DeviceInfo.description:
-  General information that originates from the device description file
-  These information are shown in the tab 'Information' of the device editor

name.example: S20-EC-BK, IndraControl S20 EtherCAT Fieldbus coupler

version.description: If version information is not given, newest version is selected automatically.

description.example: EtherCAT Slave imported from Slave XML: S20-EC-BK_019.XML Device: S20-EC-BK, IndraControl S20 EtherCAT BuskopplerS20-EC-BK, IndraControl S20 EtherCAT Fieldbus coupler

installedDevices.name: IndraDrive MPC08 (1 CCD Master +5 CCD Slaves)
IndraDrive MPC08 (1 CCD Master +5 CCD Slaves)

DevicePlug.description: Plug device to an empty slot.

DeviceRepositoryJob.description: Saves the current devices in the device cache. Use after adding or removing many devices.

DevicesTopLevel.description: Top level **Devices** view in IO Engineering.

DisableDevice.description: Disable or Enable the device. If set to **true**, device will be disabled. Should be used with **PATCH** request only.

DeviceUserLoginJob.description: The job logins the user to the device.

DeviceUserLogoutJob.description: The job logout the device user.

id.description: Resource identifier of an ECAD system.

EthercatSlaveInfo.description: Includes the general information of the ethercat slave.

ethercatAddress.description: EtherCAT address of the slave, also called Fixed Physical Address. The address is not saved in the slave, but the master assigns this address to the slave upon bus startup.

ExportJob.description: The job 'ExportJob' is used to export the specified node and its children if any to '.export' file format.

ExportEthercatConfigJob.description: The job 'ExportEthercatConfigJob' is used to export the specified 'Ethercat' node and its children if any to the file.

ExportUsersAndGroupsJob.description: The job 'ExportUsersAndGroupsJob' is used to export users and groups definitions of the project in a file *.users xml format.

FindElementsJob.description:
- The job 'FindElementsJob' is used to search for all the occurence of an element starting from a node including the corresponding subnodes. Search will be based on 'findText' or 'findId'.
- If both findText and findId are given, then it searches for the node which matches both id and text.

ImportJob.description: The job 'ImportJob' is used to import the given file of type '.export' on the specified node. Already existing objects will be overwritten.

ImportUsersAndGroupsJob.description: The job 'ImportUsersAndGroupsJob' is used to import the users and groups definiitions, stored in the file , into the project.

example.name: IndraDrive MPC08 (1 CCD Master +5 CCD Slaves)

name.example: IndraDrive MPC08 (1 CCD Master +5 CCD Slaves)

jobType.description: one of available jobTypes (e.g. ProjectJob, ExportEthercatConfigJob, MoveElementsJob, FindElementsJob, NewProjectJob, UserManagementLogInJob, UserManagementLogOutJob, ExportUsersAndGroupsJob, ImportUsersAndGroupsJob, DeviceUserLogoutJob, DeviceUserLoginJob, TransferFieldbusConfigJob, ExportJob, ImportJob, CommunicationSettingsJob, DeviceRepositoryJob, ScanAndMergeDevicesJob )

progress.description: Progress of the task in percent

MoveElementsJob.description: The job 'MoveElementsJob' is used to shift the element from one node to another including all the submodules.

NewProjectJob.description: The job 'NewProjectJob' is used to create a new project.

Path.description: For example path to a library file or path to save a project.

PousTopLevel.description: Top level **POUs** view in IO Engineering.

Project.description: Includes everything for the production of a control program.

ProjectJob.description:
- 'Open' opens project as current project
- 'Close' closes current project without saving. Project files wiill be deleted, on close of new project that has not been saved.
- 'Save' saves the current project. If a 'path' is contained, 'save as' is performed

ProjectSettings.description:
ProjectSettings contains a set of options to configure project.
Element with fixed name. It's name in IO Engineering is language dependent. Node 'Project Settings' is added by default when a project is created. This node cannot be deleted or added again.

ScanAndMergeDevicesJob.description: This job is used to scan and merge devices to Project.

TransferFieldbusConfigJob.description: The job transfers the fieldbus configuration to the controller.

User.description: Displays the users and their memberships in groups

memberships.description: List of all user groups that you have defined in addition to the group Everyone (to which each new user automatically belongs).
List of all user groups that you have defined in addition to the group Everyone (to which each new user automatically belongs).

UserManagementLogInJob.description: The job 'UserManagementLogInJob' is used to log in defined user for the opened project. User cannot login if 'logoutAfterTimeOfInactivity' is True. So internally while performing the login, it will be set to false.

UserManagementLogOutJob.description: The job 'UserManagementLogOutJob' is used to logout from the current project.

UsersAndGroupsEditor.description:
This editor is for the configuration of the user management for the current project. This is the global settings, which can be configured from node 'ProjectSettings'.
Element with fixed name. It's name in IO Engineering is language dependent.

Problem.description: This document defines a "problem detail" as a way  to carry machine-readable details of errors in a  HTTP response to avoid the need to define new error  response formats for HTTP APIs.

type.description:
A URI reference [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type. 
This specification encourages that, when dereferenced, 
it provide human-readable documentation for the problem type 
(e.g., using HTML [W3C.REC-html5-20141028]). When this member 
is not present, its value is assumed to be "about:blank".

title.description:
A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. 
It SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, 
except for purposes of localization (e.g., using proactive content 
negotiation; see [RFC7231], Section 3.4).
title.example: You do not have enough credit.

status.description:
The HTTP status code ([RFC7231], Section 6) generated by the 
origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.
detail.example: Your current balance is 30, but that costs 50.

instance.description:
A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.
It may or may not yield further information if dereferenced.

code.description:
An error code issued by the system that caused the original problem.
This code can be used to track down the root cause of the error.

mainDiagnosisCode.description:
The main diagnosis code is issued by the system that caused the problem.
This code can be used to track down the root cause and source of the error.
It can be used to search in the documentation for a solution.
It SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the same problem.

detailedDiagnosisCode.description:
The detailed diagnosis code issued by the system that caused the problem.
This code can be used to track down the detailed cause and source of the error.
It can be used to search in the documentation for a solution.
The detailed diagnosis code gives additional information about the cause of the error.
It SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the same problem.

dynamicDescription.description:
A dynamic description gives detailed information about the occurrence of a problem.
It can change between different occurrences of the same error.

severity.description: Severity of a problem as defined RFC5424 of the Syslog standard, see https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5424

links.description:
Collection of links to fix the problem. E.g. links to online user manual,
to an online community (using tags) or a developer chat (e.g. Slack).

nodeUrl.description: ctrlX device node for which job needs to be executed.

isOnline.description: isOnline will be **true**, if the device is online. Otherwise it will be **false**.

disable.description: Disable or Enable the device. If set to **true**, device will be disabled. Should be used with **PATCH** request only.

nodeUrl.description: ctrlX device node for which job needs to be executed.
ctrlX device node for which job needs to be executed.
node and its child nodes which needs to be exported

filePath.description: path where export file needs to be saved

fileName.description: name of the file (with or without extension). If property 'oneFilePerSubtree' is true, file name is ignored

oneFilePerSubtree.description: if true, one file per subtree is generated

nodeUrl.description: ethercat node which needs to be exported

filePath.description: path where file needs to be saved

fileName.description: name of the file.xml and ini file extensions are supported.

filePath.description: path where *.users xml file needs to be saved

fileName.description: name of the file (with or without extension).

nodeUrl.description: Path of the node from where the search has to begin.

matchCase.description: Finds all occurrences with the exact combination of uppercase and lowercase letters specified in the findText. Default value is false.

matchWholeWord.description: Searches for the complete word. Default value is false.

matchedNodeUrls.description: Lists the path of all the nodes, which matches the findId and findText.

nodeUrl.description: node on which '.export' file needs to be imported

fileName.description: name of the file (with or without extension) that needs to be imported.
name of the file (with or without extension .users) that needs to be imported.

sourceNodeUrl.description: Source location of the node which has to be shifted.

destinationNodeUrl.description: Destination location to which the node has to be shifted.

insertPosition.description:
- Position where the sourceNode has to be inserted.
- If the value is not specified then default value -1 will be set.
- If the value is -1 or out of index node will be inserted at the last position.
- If the value is 0 then it will be inserted at the begining.
- If the nodes are sorted in alphabetical order, then insertion will be based on the node name.

filePath.description: path where the created project need to be saved.

template.description: Depending on the template, user can obtain a project that is automatically equipped with a certain range of objects.

keepProjectVersion.description: Default value is false. If false, Project will be converted to latest version and opened. If true, project will not be opened.

nodeUrl.description: node on which scan is performed.
Path of the node whose configuration has to be transfered.

allowSwitchState.description: Switch the system state to set up or the EtherCAT state to init, if necessary. The default value is true.

users.description: Displays the users and their memberships in groups.

groups.description: Displays the groups and their members. A group can also be a member of a group.
